name: 莎士比亞（二）
goals: To provide an introduction to the major plays of William Shakespeare
Students will encounter and enjoy in each semester four major plays of the author.
syllabus:
Shakespeare in Performance

This course provides an introduction to the major plays of William Shakespeare. With this course, students will encounter and enjoy in each semester four major plays of the author. The four plays to be studied vary from year to year. They are usually decided in class at the beginning of each semester after orientation in the first week.

Students will encounter and enjoy in each semester four major plays of the author.  Along the way they will also have opportunities to become aquainted with the rich resources of Shakespeare studies.

Requirements:

1\. Students who select this course are expected to write two coherent and well-organized essays (3000 words in Chinese, or 1500 words in English), and submit their individual assignments on time. 

2\. Regular and prompt attendance at classes is also demanded. Being late for over 15 minutes will be counted as an absence. Every absence will result in three points being deducted from the final grade average. Three absences might result in a total failure of the course.   
  
Some relevant reading materials:  
1\. Bentley, Gerald Eades, ed. _The Seventeenth-Century Stage_. Chicago and London: U of Chicago P, 1968.  
2\. Biggs, Murray, et al., eds. _The Arts of Performance in Elizabethan and Early Stuart Drama_. Edinburgh: Edinburgh UP, 1991.  
3\. Greenblatt, Stephen, ed. _The Norton Shakespeare, Based on the Oxford Edition_. NY and London: Norton, 2008.  
4\. Gurr, Andrew. _The Shakespearean Stage_, 1574-1642. 3rd ed. Cambridge: Cambridge UP, 1992.  
5\. Hinman, Charlton, ed. _The First Folio of Shakespeare_. New York: Norton, 1968.

6\. ---, ed. _The First Folio of Shakespeare, Based on the Folger Shakespeare Library Collection_. 2nd ed. New York: Norton, 1996.  
7\. Norman, Marc, and Tom Stoppard. _Shakespeare in Love: A Screenplay_. NY: Hyperion, 1998.  
8\. Taylor, Gary, John Jowett, Terri Bourus, and Gabriel Egan, eds. _The New Oxford Shakespeare: The Complete Works_. Edited by Gary Taylor, John Jowett, Terri Bourus, and Gabriel Egan. Oxford: Oxford UP, 2016.
